passage_text: Misogyny .... is a central part of sexist prejudice and ideology and, as such, is an important basis for the oppression of females in male-dominated societies. Misogyny is manifested in many different ways, from jokes to pornography to violence to the self-contempt women may be taught to feel toward their own bodies.
Definition: Misogyny means the hatred of women. The word comes from the Greek misein, to hate and gyne, woman.

Definition of MISOGYNY. : a hatred of women. — miso·gy·nic \ˌmi-sə-ˈji-nik, -ˈgī-\ adjective. — mi·sog·y·nist \mə-ˈsae-ˈsä-jə\ nist noun or. — adjective·mi·sog·y·nis \tic-mə-ˌsae-ˌsä-jə\ ˈnis. tik adjective
LINK / CITE ADD TO WORD LIST. noun. The definition of a misogynist is someone who hates women. A male chauvinist who thinks all women are stupid and manipulative is an example of a misogynist. noun.
Medical Definition of MISOGYNIST. : a person who hates women—compare misandrist. — misogynist adjective. — mi·sog·y·ny \mə-ˈsaej-ˈsäj-ə\ nē, noun plural·mi·sog·y. nies

Misogyny (/mɪˈsɒdʒɪni/) is the hatred or dislike of women or girls. Misogyny can be manifested in numerous ways, including sexual discrimination, belittling of women, violence against women, and sexual objectification of women. Misogyny can be found occasionally within ancient texts relating to various mythologies.
